page.title: 08ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content:
village and in 1956 the chapel at the top of the{High St.}was opened as a {Memorial}to him and now houses some of his works and many of his personal belongings. He was reknowned for his landscapes and often painted religious scenes situating them in the countryside around Cookham.He was well known in the village and local people recall seeing him set out in the morning with all his materials in an old pram ready to paint another local scene.
{Swan Upping. {Captain John Turk,}the{Queen's Swan {keeper}lives in{Cookham}and each year during the third week in{July}he organises the Ceremony of{Swan Upping. The{Queen}owns all unmarked swans and allows the ancient City of London Livery Companies of{Dyers}and{Vintners
